batchtools
  • Get Started
  • Reference
  • News

Synchronous Apply Functions

This is a set of functions acting as counterparts to the sequential popular apply functions in base R: btlapply for lapply and btmapply for mapply.

Internally, jobs are created using batchMap on the provided registry. If no registry is provided, a temporary registry (see argument file.dir of makeRegistry) and batchMap will be used. After all jobs are terminated (see waitForJobs), the results are collected and returned as a list.

Note that these functions are one suitable for short and fail-safe operations on batch system. If some jobs fail, you have to retrieve partial results from the registry directory yourself.

btlapply(X, fun, ..., resources = list(), n.chunks = NULL,
  chunk.size = NULL, reg = makeRegistry(file.dir = NA))

btmapply(fun, ..., more.args = list(), simplify = FALSE, use.names = TRUE,
  resources = list(), n.chunks = NULL, chunk.size = NULL,
  reg = makeRegistry(file.dir = NA))

Arguments

X

[vector] Vector to apply over.
fun

[function] Function to apply.
...

[ANY] Additional arguments passed to fun (btlapply) or vectors to map over (btmapply).
resources

[named list] Computational resources for the jobs to submit. The actual elements of this list (e.g. something like “walltime” or “nodes”) depend on your template file, exceptions are outlined in the details. In case you need to set individual job resources, ids may be provided as data.frame with the additional column “resources” (see example). Default settings for a system can be set in the configuration file by defining the named list default.resources. Note that these settings are merged by name, e.g. merging list(walltime = 300) into list(walltime = 400, memory = 512) will result in list(walltime = 300, memory = 512).
n.chunks

[integer(1)] Passed to chunk before submitJobs.
chunk.size

[integer(1)] Passed to chunk before submitJobs.
reg

[Registry] Registry. If not explicitly passed, uses the default registry (see setDefaultRegistry).
more.args

[list] Additional arguments passed to fun.
simplify

[logical(1)] Simplify the results using simplify2array?
use.names

[logical(1)] Use names of the input to name the output?

Value

[list] List with the results of the function call.

Examples

btlapply(1:3, function(x) x^2)
#> Sourcing configuration file '/home/lang/.config/batchtools/config.R' ...
#> Created registry in '/tmp/batchtools-example/reg' using cluster functions 'Interactive'
#> Adding 3 jobs ...
#> Submitting 3 jobs in 3 chunks using cluster functions 'Interactive' ...
#> ### [bt]: Setting seed to 1 ...
#> ### [bt]: Setting seed to 2 ...
#> ### [bt]: Setting seed to 3 ...
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
btmapply(function(x, y, z) x + y + z, x = 1:3, y = 1:3, more.args = list(z = 1), simplify = TRUE)
#> Sourcing configuration file '/home/lang/.config/batchtools/config.R' ...
#> Created registry in '/scratch/registry1c3017ef3628' using cluster functions 'Interactive'
#> Adding 3 jobs ...
#> Submitting 3 jobs in 3 chunks using cluster functions 'Interactive' ...
#> ### [bt]: Setting seed to 1 ...
#> ### [bt]: Setting seed to 2 ...
#> ### [bt]: Setting seed to 3 ...
#> [1] 3 5 7
